activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darien A. Coberley

records.addlTxt:
2:26 PM 21CF97, 22CF19, 22CM50, and unfiled Case - Defendant Darien A. Coberley in court, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Darien A. Coberley. Attorney Richards speaks about the joint agreement of 1 year in the county jail without huber on 21CF97 with 160 days credit. 22CF19, entering a change of plea with 3 years probation and 90 days conditional jail time that are consecutive to 21CF97.  All other cases will be dismissed. Unfiled case will not be prosecuted. 

Court goes over the defendant's rights. Defendant enters a NC plea. Attorney Richards states that there was a waiver filed of the preliminary hearing.

Court goes over the information in 22CF19. Defendant enters a guilty plea.

21CF97 - Attorney Richards agrees that there are 160 days credit on the sentencing after revocation. Attorney Harper comments. 

DC asks about drug court. Attorney Harper asks that the defendant participate in drug court as a condition of probation, if he is eligible. 

Court orders 21CF97; count 2 - 1 year in the Richland County Jail. 160 days credit. Huber eligibility subject to the Defendant's eligibility for and admission into treatment court. Court has ordered that, once the Defendant has been admitted to the treatment court, as confirmed by the treatment court coordinator and communicated to the jail by the treatment court coordinator, he shall be eligible for Huber. Until that point, Huber is not allowed.

Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 3 years in 22CF19. Conditions: 90 days conditional jail time - stayed until further review of the court. Court set review date. Defendant must participate in and complete drug treatment court, if eligible. Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent. Obey all rules and regulations of the department. Costs waived. Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department. Sign up for probation today

22CM50 - DRI

Unfiled case - Court releases the defendant from bond. Attorney Harper indicates the State will not bring forth charges.
Status conference on July 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Darien A. Coberley
Current: 203 W Sunny Lane, Janesville, WI 53546 United States  (Effective: 04-19-2022)
Prior: 700 Allison Park Dr., Richland Center, WI 53581
On 4/13/22, the Defendant's previous cash bond was amended to a signature bond while on ATR. Once released from ATR, bond is to revert back to $1000 cash.

4:23 PM 22CF19/22CM50  - Defendant Darien A. Coberley in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Darien A. Coberley. Attorney Richards states that there is a motion on bond. Attorney Harper states that the motion is amend to a signature bond for ATR and then release reverted back to a cash bond. Court amends bond per conditions provided by Attorney Harper. Attorney Harper asks for a hearing 90 days out. Court removes the April 26, 2022 date and time.
Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on July 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on April 13, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Motion hearing on April 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:03 PM Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video means for Defendant Darien A. Coberley. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court quashes warrant. Attorney Forehand asks for $1,000  cash bond. Defendant Darien A. Coberley appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Attorney Richards asks that the signature bond be reinstated. Court orders $1,000 cash bond. Max penalties stated. Attorney Richards waives the preliminary hearing. Court binds over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:00 PM Defendant Darien A. Coberley appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court reset to allow DC attorney to appear. Warrant is still active.  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
